column4: I don't think you get what I'm saying. I already know that Ubuntu is easy, but that's not what I asked. I asked if anyone could suggest any good addons that would make it easier for a Windows user to switch to, such as themes / etc. I'd much rather you tried to answer my question rather than telling me something irrelevant, although I appreciate your input.
how would you make it easier for a Windows user to switch to Ubuntu?
Some of us have network security issues
Has access control occurred to you? If I start a service, I don't necessarily want anyone anywhere to be able to use it.
It also has potential for multi user environments by limiting external and internal port access, like blocking IRC ports when 8 year old cousins are around. ;)
if you start the service, then configure the service correctly
Not every service is the same or is configurable with ACL settings. Squid? No problem. Tor? Not so much.
That's an unfair rationalization -- just because it's simple doesn't mean it isn't effective. Firestarter is simply a GUI for iptables rulesets.
If you have a problem with iptables, then don't use it.
The GUI is designed to be more of a configuration utility, not a service itself
Unless I misunderstood your last message
yah, so there's not a lot of point of running firestarter at startup
'cos it only configures iptables for you
Of course there isn't a lot of point, but I'm in here to help people with their problems, not tell them how to run their box
Although some people use it since it does list diagnostic information like amount of data transmitted and what it considers high-security attacks it's blocked
